file_content.text: So many of my workers have perished out there. I know you tried to find my lost supplies. Thanks for the effort.
Thanks to you, my men in the field are safe and fed--and the factory is booming.
You've returned! I hope you were able to acquire my lost supplies. My workers are starving.
I don't know how much longer they can last.
Here are the supplies for your men.
I brought them for you.
Yes! I knew you'd be the answer! These rations and medicines will go a long way toward helping my suffering workers.
You've made a great difference here today, friend. Here's your reward.
Be warned, Zillyons is a plant and he's trying to expose you.
Don't trust your assistant.
What? That's... that's very unfortunate--and helpful to know. Thank you.
The truth is, our productivity has doubled thanks to my methods. So, the Empire is benefitting, not suffering.
That makes sense to me. You're doing the Empire a great service.
I agree.
I appreciate your support. And your warning.
Save your rationalizations for someone who cares.
I can't be bothered.
Lucky for me you're not a code-thumper like Zillyons.
Stealing is stealing, even if it's for a magnanimous reason.
It's still wrong.
If the Empire won't send me what I need to keep my workers safe and strong, I'll do what must be done.
And Zillyons won't catch one whiff of my endeavors ever again. Thanks.
Much obliged.
It's the least I can do. Be well, friend.
I know you're skimming off the top here, so you can do better than that.
Pay more or I'll expose you.
How did you...? Oh, no matter. I'm grateful you're not turning me in. Here's all the credits I have.
Just know, I don't profit from this operation. Every extra credit you siphon from me puts a hardworking innocent man at risk.
I'm alright with that.
Doesn't bother me.
Fine. It's worth it to see my men well-fed and safe.
You're traipsing dangerously close to being dead.
Would you rather I kill you?
I--I meant no disrespect. After all, you have helped me and my men today.
I changed my mind. Use it to help your men.
Keep the extra credits.
Thank you for seeing it that way.
Good day to you.
Not yet. You better keep those fingers crossed.
[Lie] I haven't found them.
I'd cross my eyes too, but I don't think I'd get much work done.
If someone like you can't retrieve those supplies, there may be no hope. Please don't give up. I'll be waiting right here.
My workers in the field are on their last legs. Please see my assistant at the Troida warehouse and locate our missing supplies.
Say, are you interested in some work? I've got a major dilemma I need help with.
Tell me.
I appreciate the ear. 'Cause this problem could really snowball if it isn't taken care of.
For the right price, I'd do just about anything.
Join the party.
I'd hardly expect you to work for free. Although, it's a pretty worthy cause--you might want to just sign on.
I don't have a lot of time.
Fast-talking is an occupational necessity for me.
I've got workers, without supplies, in some pretty dangerous zones.
Supplies are always short, and now an important shipment has been lost en route from Sobrik.
Food, essential medicines--all earmarked for my men in the field. Without those supplies, they're goners.
Let me guess, you need me to go find your lost supplies.
I know what you want.
If it pleases you, yes. I would be forever in your debt.
I won't let that happen.
I'm not interested in helping you. Sorry.
Then they're goners.
If I have to replace my men, the lost productivity will significantly affect the war effort. Here and abroad.
I need those supplies. Another shipment won't be secured for weeks. Won't you please reconsider helping me?
Fine.
I love it when the Empire works together! This is how it ought to be.
I need compensation.
I wouldn't expect you to help me for nothing. I'll be able to scrape something together for you.
My assistant, Treezl Zillyons, was tracking the supplies. He has an idea of where they were lost.
He's stationed at our most forward warehouse. The trek is pretty hazardous, but he can point you in the right direction.
I don't mind hazards. They just make life interesting.
Sounds exciting.
I wish I had what it takes to face life that way.
You won't have to wait long.
So there's more to this, huh?
My assistant is very no-nonsense. He'll make things clear, I'm sure.
I'm so relieved to have you working on this. I will be waiting here.
No. [Refuse quest]
Too bad. What a waste. Well, if you think better of it, please come see me.
Now's not a good time to talk. I'm dealing with a worker crisis.
Not only does their work suffer, which compromises Troida's ability to supply the Empire, but in many cases, their lives are in jeopardy.
They're not slaves. They're compensated for their time and the risk.
They get paid, don't they?
Well, it's not a lot. And what good is that if you're not around to spend it?
That's unfortunate.
Maybe you can help me do something about it.
Your life's in jeopardy if you don't get to the point.
I'm growing impatient.
Well, I won't be very effective if I'm dead, will I?
They'll either rise to the occasion and survive, or they'll die.
They should save themselves.
These are not the concerns of a Sith.
This is beneath me.
Please, before you dismiss me, please just hear me out.
The galaxy is a dangerous place. Life is always in jeopardy.
So is everyone's.
Hey, this is a restricted zone. It's dangerous, you gotta be wearing protective....
Oh, nevermind, you look like you can protect yourself.
But in this case, it's completely avoidable.
